WATCH: For the last few decades, companies have manipulated Chapter 11 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code to destroy union contracts, reduce health benefits and skirt pension obligations to maximize profits. My bill, the SLAP Act, will stop that. pic.twitter.com/ekyFFyNgF3

Congress can no longer allow corporations to continue this exploitation of the bankruptcy code to maximize profits and skirt their obligations to the company‚Äôs employees. I urge my colleagues to support the #SLAPAct & stand with America‚Äôs working families.
My bill, the Stop Looting American Pensions (SLAP) Act, will put the workers at the front of the line and protect the hard-earned pensions of American workers. pic.twitter.com/V9JZvpEO38

At the end of Friendly Ice Cream's bankruptcy, most of Friendly‚Äôs assets were owned by a Sun Capital affiliate free & clear of any pension claims. Those unfunded pension obligations totaled $115M and are being assumed by the PBGC.

After filing bankruptcy in 2018, Sears no longer possessed enough assets to pay off its creditors, esp. its pension obligations. Now those pensions are in the hands of the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corp (PBGC), which is Sears‚Äô largest unsecured creditors, which is owed $1.5B+

Murray Energy has contributed 97% of the money going into the UMWA pension fund annually. With Murray‚Äôs bankruptcy filing, the UMWA pension fund will become insolvent even faster, and this crisis will snowball and impact every other multi-employer pension fund in America.
It is now the responsibility and duty of Congress to stop this financial engineering and close of the loopholes of our bankruptcy code. My bill, the SLAP Act, does just that.

For the last few decades, numerous investment firms have manipulated sections of the bankruptcy code to maximize profits by cutting wages, reducing health benefits & slashing pensions. The financial engineering used for this type of manipulation has been used time and time again. pic.twitter.com/Y6nnBc3gNs

Every paycheck, 10.6M Americans put a portion of their paycheck into a pension account w/ promise & trust that it will be there when they retire. These same people forego pay raises, bonuses & personal retirement accts b/c they believe their pensions will be there until needed.

LIVE: Today I‚Äôm on the Senate floor to outline why Congress needs to pass my bill, the Stop Looting American Pensions (SLAP) Act, which would protect worker pensions during bankruptcy. Watch live on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/JoeManchinIII/videos/418075539140777/¬†‚Ä¶
